Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to deny refugee status was based on an erroneous credibility finding
Application_Facts: Inconsistencies in POE notes, PIF, and testimony
Discrepancies regarding abortion details, police detention, address
Failure to seek asylum in other countries
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Claimant_Status: Applicant claiming persecution based on Pentecost religion
Defendant_Behavior: Board assessed credibility and found applicant not credible
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged persecution due to religious belief
Legal_Standard: Decision must be perverse, capricious, or disregard material evidence to be reviewable
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony and documentation consistency
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard; no reviewable error unless decision was unreasonable
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility assessment due to inconsistencies and omissions
Legal_Provision_Cited: subsection 18.1(4) of the Federal Court Act
Application_Basis: Claim of persecution based on religion
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Board's negative refugee determination
Governing_Rule: Federal Court cannot substitute its view for that of the Board absent a reviewable error
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Significant inconsistencies across documents and testimony
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; Board's decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: No established risk of persecution due to lack of credibility
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed persecution due to Pentecost faith but failed to demonstrate credibility
Evidence_Handling: Board evaluated documentary and testimonial evidence for consistency and plausibility
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistencies in abortion details, detention claims, and travel history
Residency_Compliance: Applicant entered Canada and made a refugee claim
Misrepresentation_Element: False or misleading statements affecting credibility
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction to review IRB decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Adverse credibility findings supported by record
Decision_Rationale: The inconsistencies were sufficient to justify a negative credibility finding; no reviewable error
